Detailed Description: Opt-In / Opt-Out Compliance Discussion

During the Tech Check-in (Feb 12, 2025) meeting, Jessica Walker and Matthew Ledom discussed concerns about A2P (Application-to-Person) messaging compliance and how to ensure Care Sherpa’s SMS communications follow regulations without risking a system-wide messaging shutdown due to flagged messages.

Problem Statement: Ensuring Compliance with SMS Opt-In/Opt-Out Rules

Care Sherpa needs to implement a clear and trackable SMS opt-in process to meet A2P 10DLC regulations and HIPAA compliance.
	•	Care Sherpa’s A2P registration was approved after 60 days, but there’s uncertainty about whether one flagged message could impact all clients under the same Dialpad account.
	•	Dialpad appears to group compliance approvals at the company level, meaning one non-compliant message could result in SMS suspension for all clients.
	•	CallRail recently shut down SMS for some users, blaming the carrier for not recognizing the opt-in process.
	•	The team needs to clarify how Dialpad handles flagged messages and violations before moving all clients over.

Proposed Solution: Standardizing the Opt-In Process

To avoid compliance risks, Jessica and Matthew discussed implementing a standardized SMS opt-in process based on best practices.

1️⃣ Defining the Opt-In Process
	•	Care Sherpa will collect opt-in consent in multiple ways, depending on how a lead/patient enters the system:
	•	Web Leads: The online intake form should include a checkbox for SMS consent, with a timestamped record.
	•	Inbound Calls: If a lead calls in, the agent must verbally ask for consent before sending a text message.
	•	Physician Referrals: These leads may have implied consent, but the team needs to ensure proper documentation before sending messages.
	•	Existing Clients: If not previously consented, Care Sherpa must send a one-time opt-in message before continuing SMS communication.

2️⃣ First SMS Message Should Include Opt-In Confirmation
	•	The first text message a lead receives should include:
	•	A greeting from the provider (e.g., “This is Jessica from Dr. Gilman’s office”)
	•	A disclosure that this is a non-secure messaging channel
	•	Instructions for opting out (e.g., “Reply STOP to unsubscribe”)

Example First Message Template:

	“Hi [First Name], this is Jessica from Dr. Gilman’s office. We’re reaching out regarding your inquiry. You’ve opted in to receive SMS updates from us. Reply STOP to unsubscribe. Please do not share personal health information over text, as this is not a secure channel.”

3️⃣ Tracking Consent in the CRM & SMS Platform
	•	The CRM must store SMS opt-in status at the opportunity level, since different contacts may require separate consents.
	•	The CRM should automatically append the opt-in disclaimer to the first SMS a patient receives.
	•	If a patient replies STOP, their record should be flagged with “Do Not Contact” at both the Contact and Opportunity levels.

4️⃣ Automating Opt-In Compliance
	•	Agents need an easy way to trigger an opt-in message if consent is received verbally.
	•	The team discussed a button in the CRM that would:
	•	Fire off the opt-in message to the lead
	•	Log the opt-in timestamp in the CRM
	•	Matthew will explore Dialpad’s ability to auto-track opt-ins to ensure compliance.

5️⃣ Managing Opt-Out Requests
	•	If a patient replies STOP, Care Sherpa must:
	•	Immediately stop sending messages to that number.
	•	Flag the contact & opportunity as “Do Not Contact.”
	•	Ensure the opt-out flag syncs with Dialpad and the CRM.
	•	If a patient complains or reports a message as spam, the team needs to know:
	•	Does Dialpad shut down all client SMS, or just that number?
	•	Should each client have a separate SMS instance to avoid system-wide shutdowns?

Next Steps & Tasks to Assign

1️⃣ Confirm Compliance with Dialpad
	•	Jessica Walker to contact Dialpad support and confirm:
	•	What happens if one client gets flagged for SMS violations?
	•	Can clients have separate instances to protect others from potential shutdowns?
	•	What tracking options are available in Dialpad for SMS opt-ins?

2️⃣ Create the Opt-In Messaging Workflow
	•	Matthew Ledom to design the first SMS message template and test automation options in Dialpad and CRM.
	•	Jessica Walker to review HIPAA compliance & best practices for opt-in messaging.

3️⃣ Implement & Test Automated Opt-In Tracking
	•	Matthew Ledom to add a CRM button for manual opt-in confirmation, ensuring it:
	•	Sends the opt-in SMS.
	•	Logs the timestamp in the patient record.
	•	Syncs with Dialpad.

4️⃣ Implement “Do Not Contact” Flag
	•	Matthew Ledom to add a global “Do Not Contact” flag in the CRM that applies at both the Contact and Opportunity levels when STOP is received.
	•	Ensure any opt-out request is logged & prevents future SMS messages.

5️⃣ Train the Team on the Opt-In Process
	•	Jessica Walker to create a quick training document for agents:
	•	When and how to request opt-in.
	•	How to log opt-ins in the CRM.
	•	What to do if a patient replies STOP.
